ca.uqac.lif.cep.concurrency

Class NonBlockingPusher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.concurrency.NonBlockingPusher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable

    public class NonBlockingPusher
extends Processor
    Wrapper around a processor that makes its calls to push() non blocking.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ThreadManager.ManagedThread m_managedThread
      The thread in which the pipeline thread is running

      The processor to which events will be pushed

      A reference to the pullable this processor should pull its input from
      protected Pushable m_pushable
      The pushable to which events will be pushed
      protected Pushable m_pushableOutput
      A reference to the pushable this processor should send its output to

      The thread manager to get instances of threads

      • setPushableOutput

        public void setPushableOutput(int index,
                              Pushable p)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Assigns a Pushable to the processor's i-th output.
        Overrides:
        setPushableOutput in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the output. Should be greater than 0 (not checked) and less than the processor's output arity. Outside these bounds, nothing will occur.
        p - The pushable to assign it to

      • getPushableOutput

        public Pushable getPushableOutput(int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Retrieves the Pushable associated to the processor's i-th output.
        Overrides:
        getPushableOutput in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the output. Should be greater than 0 (not checked) and less than the processor's output arity. Outside these bounds, nothing will occur.
        Returns:
        The pushable, null if i is out of range

      • getPushableInput

        public Pushable getPushableInput(int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Returns the Pushable corresponding to the processor's i-th input trace.
        Specified by:
        getPushableInput in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index. Should be between 0 and the processor's input arity - 1 (since indices start at 0).
        Returns:
        The pushable if the index is within the appropriate range, null otherwise.
